entry.title: PyData 2014 Silicon Valley Saturday Talks
entry.summary:
Why Python is awesome for any scale data?

Why Python for Machine Learning?

  1. You want to get results quickly
  2. You will need lots of functionality
  3. C++
  4. DSL

  5. You cannot do it all by yourself.

  6. Scaling Machine Learning in PYthon

  7. Scaling Machine Learning in Pyton Slides
  8. Python Sparts by Facebook using Thrift
  9. PrestoDB by Facebook
  10. PyHive
  11. RocksDB
  12. Leveldb
  13. Tornado from Facebook

C/C++ interoperability

  • Boost.Python
  • Weave
  • Swig
  • Buck
  • Buck in Android
  • Pants from Twitter

These are mostly dependency management systems where if you do not want to deal with dependency hell, you may want to use some sort of dependency management system, Pants seems quite useful. If you are doing interoperation with C/C++, get a build system instead of depending on the venv and pip which seems not working quite well with other languages.

DSL

  • DSLs can be useful for speaking different languages.
  • Dataswam is a dependency graph description language.
  • Python is good for DSL's as well.

Full Stack Data Visualization Approach at Facebook

  • Fresh Data
  • More pixels
  • Make the data smaller

CrossFilter

  • CrossFilter in browsing D3 based visualization library.
  • CrossFilter Tutorial
  • CrossFilter Slides Tutorial

In memory database

  • Scuba Paper
  • Tornado + gzip + csv
  • DC.js is a multidimensional javascript library.
  • These tools are mostly for multidimensional aspects of the data. Not necessarily a specific part of it, but rather for different aspects of it.
  • For GeoVisualization: Leaflet.js
  • ZeroMQ for queing.
